fields.description:

fields.description:
The attached screen shot is the result of running {{git push orign}} in PowerShell. As can be seen the custom colour codes are not properly reset. Running {{clear}} results in a pink background terminal. Also as can be the colours do not contrast well with the default powershell colour scheme.

I imagine that the banner uses posix colour codes which are not properly handled on PowerShell.

Please strongly consider removing the colour codes. I cannot see how they will work well with the full variety of shells and colour schemes that git is used from.
fields.summary: New push banner message breaks colours on PowerShell

fields.description:
Hi,

We have found an issue when Bitbucket is rendering markdown files (eg Readme.md) files. We do not know if it is a browser problem or a server problem.

We were designing our "readme.md" files using Intellij and Atom. If we use spaces (0x20) for creating nested bullet-point list, the rendering in Intellij and Atom works correctly. But when we push the code to bitbucket , the nested bullet-points list are nor rendered correctly.

See the following example with spaces (0x20)

* hi

** hi
** hi2
* hi

Then if we use tab char (0x09) instead of space (0x20) the render is correct on both Intellij ,Atom and bitbucket. See the following example that use tabs (0x09)

* hi

** hi
** hi2
* hi

Using both Google Chrome and Firefox, is not possible to insert tab char using tab key, within the web editor of bitbucket.

It would be nice if bitbucket could render nested bullet point lists, as Intellij and Atom does.
fields.summary: Problem when rendering markdown files

fields.description:
I have my own Jenkins server and I want to do "git push" to my Bitbucket repo using ssh keys. I don't want to use my personal ssh key though because I have multiple repos and multiple Jenkins jobs, projects and whatnot.

when I go to Bitbucket web site to create an ssh key that would be _specific to a repo_, I see it requires Pipelines to be enabled, which means adding a pipeline yaml file and so on. I don't want to use Pipelines for this project.

are you planning to support ssh keys with access control _per repository_?

I want to create several ssh keys and define permissions per repo and per Jenkins job type, e.g. "ssh key for REPO x with PUSH permission"
fields.summary: support ssh keys per repository without requiring pipelines

fields.description:
I've seen tickets with similarities to this, but not really the same so I'm opening a new one.

We just started with bitbucket pipelines, and run our own Docker image, *but no docker commands inside the steps*. However, 85% of our build time is spent pulling those images in the Build Setup phase, from a private Docker Hub repo. This also means that parallelizing builds is just wasteful for us. I'd expect the first run to be slow, but not subsequent ones, at least within a short time period directly after.

The docker image is 1GB, which takes ~2 minutes for you to download. Is this really needed/expected? Why can't you cache it on your build agents and principally cut that time down to 0? We have turned on docker caching in the pipelines.yml, but from what I understand that only affects docker builds inside our steps, right?

Is there anything we can do to speed this up or is this how it's supposed to be?
fields.summary: Pulling images takes looong time

fields.description:
Hi,

I raised this with Atlassian support previously (PSCLOUD-4539) but they told me to raise it here.

The client I'm working with is using Atlassian Identity Manager/Access to enable SSO logins for Bitbucket Cloud. This is hooked up to their Azure AD.

We've come across a case where you can press "Logout" in Bitbucket, somebody else come along and enter a different username and be logged-in automatically as the first user. This seems like a security issue.

Please see the hastily redacted workflow here.\\
!4256160305-atlassian-access-security-bug.png|thumbnail!

We have a case where multiple developers might want to work on a shared VM and this could cause issues.

Thanks,
fields.summary: Security: Bitbucket SSO - Wrong user logged-in

fields.description:
We have some conditional build steps within our pipelines.  Due to this, when our gradle cache expires we aren't guaranteed that the next pipeline will build the full cache and so we may end up with a partial cache being built.  We then have to delete the cache manually and run our cache refresh pipeline to build the full cache.

It would be nice if there was a way to refresh a cache from a pipeline, so we can schedule it and forget about it.  Either a pipeline directive that indicates the cache should be refreshed/updated, or an API operation that invokes the delete available on the UI.
fields.summary: Create mechanism to refresh a pipelines cache

fields.description:
At the moment environment variables for Bitbucket Pipelines are predefined in the repository and team configuration.

I'd like to propose adding support for prompting predefined environment variables from the end-user when starting a pipeline or a manual step inside a pipeline. In addition it would be really useful to be able to validate the values using a regular expression.

My use-case for this functionality is performing a bugfix release where the user is prompted for the to-be-released and next version numbers before the release is started.
fields.summary: Support custom variables on step level

fields.description:
Currently we are able make {{username}} & {{password}} environment variable. I would like a feature that allow us to use environment variable for image name in pipeline.

Example:

{code}
image:
  name: $IMAGE_NAME
  username: iamapikey
  password: $APIKEY
{code}

Essentially we want to be able to reuse image name across multiple repo without having to type the name in all repo.
fields.summary: Pipeline: Add Ability to make docker image name a variable

fields.description:
When I select text and right click, there is no "cut" or "copy" option; Ctrl-C doesn't work either.

The traditional X Windows behavior - select to copy, middle click to paste - works everywhere else but (like normal cut/copy) is broken on bitbucket. I get the beginning of the text and the end, with a large amount in the middle removed.

One of my most frequent uses for the source browser is to use it to locate and copy text out, but with the current behavior I'm unable to do that. This is very frustrating.

User agent: {{Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/67.0.3396.62 Safari/537.36}}

*Update - 4th Feb 2021* 
* Currently, Highlighting a text CTRL-C does copy the information in viewing mode.
* However a right-click, does not show any Copy/Paste options.

*Workaround*
* Edit file in Bitbucket, and right click to copy 
* OR highlight text in viewing mode and use CTRL + C
fields.summary: unable to copy selected text when viewing files

fields.description:
The current pull request feature is great for the initial review pass, but it is difficult to review subsequent changes to a pull request (eg. changes made in response to review feedback).

For longer pull requests, our developers typically make initial pass comments using the pull request, and then review individual commits for subsequent changes.  This has a couple problems:

* If a submitter makes 2 (or more) corrective commits, the second commit may nullify portions of the first.  So the reviewer wastes time reviewing (and commenting on) both.
* Comments on individual commits aren't displayed in the pull requests 'Activity' tab, making it difficult to ensure that all feedback has been addressed.

Ideas:

* Possibly some way to set the root commit used for the pull request diff (so reviewers can see only the aggregate result of the subsequent commits that haven't been reviewed yet)
* Less ideal (but perhaps simpler): Show commit comments in the pull request 'Activity' tab
fields.summary: Easier mechanism for reviewing pull request changes (after initial review pass)

fields.description:
When user changed his username the page will reload and redirect to login page. At that page field "Email" is autofilled with new username. But there is no reason for that, because there is impossible to log in with username, user should enter his email address.

Steps to reproduce:

# Login into Bitbucket account.
# Go to profile page - https://bitbucket.org/@username, where is "@username" is your username.
# Go to "Settings".
# Click "Change" link near you username.
# Change your username and click "Rename" button.\\
You will see opened login page with entered your new username in "Email" field.
# Enter your password to "Password" field and click "Log in" button.
# You will get an error message "You can no longer log in with a username. Use your Atlassian account email address instead.".

_Actual result_\\
After changing username the login page will opened and "Email" field autofilled with new username.

_Expected result_\\
After changing username the login page will opened and "Email" field autofilled with user email address or it will be empty.
fields.summary: Email field autofilled with new username after it has been changed

h1. Issue
Related to Issue BCLOUD-15844

I understand that the docker auth plugin is used to ensure that no directories *above* $BITBUCKET_CLONE_DIR are mounted for security reasons.\\
My issues is that no directories *below* $BITBUCKET_CLONE_DIR can be mounted either.

This bug started between 2018/06/08 and 2018/06/12

h1. Usecase
I have two repositories:

# Application source code.
# Docker container for the application.

Pushing commits to the second repo should trigger a build of the image, clone the application source code down, mount to the container and run the tests, then push to dockerhub. My problem is that I can't clone the application source code directly to $BITBUCKET_CLONE_DIR because it's not empty (the docker files are there).

I can't include my docker image in the application repo, because if I rebuild and push the docker image for every single test of the application I'll run out of build minutes.

h1. Error
This bug started between 2018/06/08 and 2018/06/12. The git clone step on the docker repo was actually working on 2018/06/08, mounting a directory *below* $BITBUCKET_CLONE_DIR. As of today (2018/06/12) it fails with this error:

{code}
docker: Error response from daemon: authorization denied by plugin pipelines: -v only supports $BITBUCKET_CLONE_DIR.
{code}

I have tried both {{-v $PWD/ApplicationSrc:/some/dir/on/docker}} and {{-v $BITBUCKET_CLONE_DIR/ApplicationSrc:/some/dir/on/docker}} both of which returned the same error.

I'd really appreciate if the auth plugin could be reverted to allow mounting of directories *below*  $BITBUCKET_CLONE_DIR
fields.summary: Docker authorization plugin won't allow mouting volume below $BITBUCKET_CLONE_DIR

fields.description:
Hi,

I would like to have an option to disable receiving emails from other Pull Request reviewers.

The only option now is to stop watching the pull request, but this also disables the email notification from the Author when he/she updates the pull request.
fields.summary: Stop receiving emails from other reviewers

fields.description: Usually g + d makes the browser go back to the Bitbucket Dashboard, but after upgrading to 5.11.1 that no longer works.
fields.summary: Dashboard keyboard shortcut broken when viewing PR

fields.description:
For long branchnames the origin branch (that will be merged) is shortened. This means it can't easily be copied.

We often checkout a branch locally to test any changes that were made. Being able to copy and paste the branch name would speed up this process.
fields.summary: Show branch name in copyable way on pull request

fields.description: Broken tile Icon for "pipeline".
fields.summary: Broken Tile Icon for Pipeline

fields.description:
Will be a lot of useful a page with all user activity history (commits in all repositories) and allow to navigate to the beggining. As "Recent activity" sidebar on my profile, but with all history paginated.

In a week I can work in a lot of projects and is very difficult to create a weekly/monthly report without a full user history.

Thanks! :)
fields.summary: All user activity history

fields.description:
Clicking "Log Out" from the user icon menu bottom left of the page redirects to this page:

https://id.atlassian.com/login

but doesn't actually log out of bitbucket... upon navigating to bitbucket.org I land right back in my account without needing to login.

Only clearing browser cache appears to effectively logout. This is a security issue when not accessing bitbucket from a personal machine.

[EDIT]

This appears to be due to use of third party cookies in the logout process.

It is not uncommon to disable third party cookies in light of excessive tracking through advertising now.
fields.summary: "Log out" does not actually log out

fields.description:
In our workflow a self-approved pull request is ready for review by the other reviewers. It is tedious to click through a list of all the pull requests to see which ones are ready or adding [WIP] or other notes to the pull request title to make it manageable.

The easiest solution would be adding the checkmark the other reviewers get to the authors icon in front of the pull request to make it clear which ones are self-approved and ready for review.
fields.summary: self-approving pull request should be visible in the list like other reviewer approves

fields.description:
Hi Team,

I would like to report an issue to you:

Side navigation bar doesn't close as expected when trying to drag it closed.

Issue occurs on Windows 10 using Firefox 60.0.1 64-bit. But it's also affecting others using Chrome.

fields.description:
Hi,

We are experiencing an error: _This merge is too large to display_. This is possibly related to  BCLOUD-8716 a few years ago.

Would you be able to check this out?

Regards,

Age Vellinga
fields.summary: This merge is too large to display

fields.description:
In web developement it is important to see the image size in kb, please make it easy to see the image size in commits.

!559029171-Sk%C3%A6rmbillede%202018-06-11%20kl.%2009.50.44.png|thumbnail!

fields.description: It is quite disturbing to have a button "add repositories" in the Projects view that does not allow you to create a new repository. This hurts the User eXperience.

fields.description:
Is seems like sidebar icon for Pipelines is broken:

!602753080-pipelines_icon.png|thumbnail!

I checked using Chrome Web Dev tools, The requested SVG icon file returns 404:\\
https://bitbucket-connect-icons.s3.amazonaws.com/add-on/icons/bba0a6b1-2736-4869-97b3-00ca083e4504.svg

I'm using Chrome, ad-blockers are turned off.

My project is:\\
https://bitbucket.org/codsen/array-includes-with-glob/\\
my last pipeline rendered successfully, but success or failure of pipelines should not cause UI to break anyway.

Please check your UI icon paths.
fields.summary: Pipelines Sidebar nav bar icon is broken

fields.description:
Hi I am trying to run bitbucket pipelines on my master branch and having the same issue from last two hours. I am the admin of my repositories. I tried logout and logging in back multiple times but it still is giving me the same error always.

GIT_LFS_SKIP_SMUDGE=1 git clone -n https://x-token-auth:$REPOSITORY_OAUTH_ACCESS_TOKEN@bitbucket.org/xxx/xxx.git $BUILD_DIR ; git checkout e16c1e4730ddcfd9xxxx ; git remote set-url origin git@bitbucket.org:xxx/xxx.git Cloning into '/opt/atlassian/pipelines/agent/build'... remote: unable to authorize current user, internal server error fatal: unable to access 'https://x-token-auth:$REPOSITORY_OAUTH_ACCESS_TOKEN@bitbucket.org/xxx/xxx.git/': The requested URL returned error: 500
fields.summary: Bitbucket-pipelines reporting error 500

fields.description:
I'm having problems with pipelines and it seems to be related to an issue from yesterday (BCLOUD-14039). Here's the output, of the very first step:

GIT_LFS_SKIP_SMUDGE=1 git clone --branch="feature/docker-pipelines" --depth 50 https://x-token-auth:$REPOSITORY_OAUTH_ACCESS_TOKEN@bitbucket.org/xxx/yyy.git $BUILD_DIR ; git reset --hard 3fd2599c6720f0c10207a50f0c67586b2aa7c9e4 ; git remote set-url origin git@bitbucket.org:xxx/yyy.git Cloning into '/opt/atlassian/pipelines/agent/build'... remote: unable to authorize current user, internal server error fatal: unable to access 'https://x-token-auth:$REPOSITORY_OAUTH_ACCESS_TOKEN@bitbucket.org/xxx/yyy.git/': The requested URL returned error: 500
fields.summary: Problem deploying with Pipelines - Auth 500 error on git clone
Build setup step failed in pipeline

fields.description: We have about 170 environment variables, and trying to modify them in the UI is a major headache. It would be very helpful to allow import/export and editing of environment variables in batches in a text file, similar to how Postman, Wufoo and other services allow.
fields.summary: Allow editing environment variables in batches

fields.description: It would be handy to have 2 buttons, to quickly switch from commits to commits. For the moment, I have to go back in commit index page and it takes some time to load that I loose to browse my commits on a certain branch.
fields.summary: View previous and next commit in commit view

fields.description:
Hi there,

when I try to reply to a comment made from somebody to a specific LOC inside a pull request the "reply" link is broken.

Nothing happens except the url gets a new anchor "#reply".

Replying to regular pull request comments does work btw.

Tested on Win10 Pro with Firefox (latest) & Chrome (latest).

I see it as a kind of critical bug because we cannot use our code review process as usual.

Thanks for fixing the issue!
fields.summary: Pull request inline comment reply broken

fields.description: When visualising a pull-request with multiple commits, allow switching to a "Diff per commit" view, where each commit can analysed separately (similar to Gerrit behaviour).
fields.summary: Allow viewing diff per commit in a pull-request

fields.description:
All files basically look the same because all file icons are black in the repository.

How about creating colorful file icons depending on their file extension? E.g.:

!3377902168-Unbenannt.png|thumbnail!

All icons are SVGs and I'm currently using a userscript which does this for me. It makes it more pleasant to look at a list of files with different extensions.
fields.summary: Color Icons depending on File Extension

fields.description:
We are part of the NetFoundry.io account, We are facing Pipeline Build Error for our Pull Request Builds, based on the observation, we found that "It's same TimeOut Issue we had earlier".

Caused by: org.eclipse.jgit.api.errors.TransportException: Read timed out after 5,000 ms

Due to this error, we could not able to merge our code into mainbranch. We kindly request you to check the infra capacity for our account and do resolve this issue.

If any Questions, please contact : arumugam.maruthanayagam@netfoundry.io olaf.luetkehoelter@netfoundry.io

Thank you
fields.summary: Pipeline Build is Failing Due to Timeout

fields.description:
!2325037144-Screen%20Shot%202018-06-07%20at%208.54.47%20PM.png|thumbnail!

Please see screenshot.

The bitrise webhooks to get build status updates were working until the late afternoon around 3-4 PM EST.\\
When a PR is created, bitrise.io starts building without a problem, so the webhook to trigger a build is fine but we're not getting any updates after the build is completed in order to merge our PRs.
fields.summary: Not receiving webhook build status (Bitrise)

fields.description:
Hi,

My name is Chirayu shah. I work at pulse biosciences. We have created different repository. we have enabled the watching on this different repository so that anyone commits sends the email but it seems it never send the email. It seems there is some bug there.

Thanks

Chirayu
fields.summary: Watching the Project doesn't work

fields.description:
When looking at the commits screen in a project, there is a search box in the upper right, but terms in Cyrillic never match anything.

I'm attaching the following screenshots (the repo is private!):

1 - This works https://bitbucket.org/4bits-mirela/mirela/commits/all?search=olx

2 - This finds nothing, despite matching commits being visible in the list above https://bitbucket.org/4bits-mirela/mirela/commits/all?search=%D0%BB%D0%BE%D0%B3%D0%B2%D0%B0%D0%BD%D0%B5
fields.summary: Searching commits doesn't work with Cyrillic

fields.description:
In front end development it's usually pretty helpful to include a short preview of the UI element/behavior you've created or modified. A lot of the time a simple screen shot is not good enough and you want to include a motion. Normally this is OK with inlining a GIF in your PR but with 1MB file size cap your gifs have to be extremely short and low resolution.

It would be nice if it was possible to inline video (such as mp4s) the same way gifs are inlined. Video is much more efficient size wise and something that would be way over 1MB in size in gif format is takes a trivial amount of space in video format.
fields.summary: Support inline video attachments

fields.description:
We are using Pipeline's "docker" service to start containers as part of our testing suite. Yesterday, our tests started failing with timeouts while waiting for the containerized processes they start to being responding to requests.

About 18 hours, containers which typically respond to requests in less than 10 seconds still did were not responding to requests after 10 minutes. Right now, the problem is better, but containers are still much slower than we are used to and status.bitbucket.org reports no issues right now

https://bitbucket.org/contrastsecurity/java-agent/addon/pipelines/home#!/results/680
fields.summary: Dramatically slower Pipelines builds causing test timeouts

fields.description:
Because large commits are slow / hard to navigate in the UI, I've been looking for anything to help. Hiding some of the files would be great.

Both of the linked Chrome extensions hide or fold files in pull-requests in a useful way, but I think that there's probably a better native way in the Bitbucket front-end.

https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/bitbucket-pull-request-re/aikikoaeiajkpmicefgjfgmaibbhbmho

https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/bitbucket-pull-request-to/hfebajohpclnfhfnlhgndbmcdnlchjjd
fields.summary: Consider a way in the view of pull-requests/commits to hide a file
Enable setting fast-forward merge as the default merge strategy for a project
[UI] Comment for diff. Dropdown hide behind comment block border
Webhooks don't trigger on push

fields.description:
*Note:* I'm trying to learn how to use the Pipelines feature so I might be missing something, in such case sorry for that but I can't find any information about this issue.

I successfully run some pipelines using the default docker image or the suggested PHP one, but if I try to use both "ubuntu" or "debian" it fails to connect using ssh:

{code}
@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@
@       WARNING: POSSIBLE DNS SPOOFING DETECTED!          @
@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@
The ECDSA host key for ********** has changed,
and the key for the corresponding IP address ***.***.***.***
is unknown. This could either mean that
DNS SPOOFING is happening or the IP address for the host
and its host key have changed at the same time.
...
{code}

*Note:* running {{cat ~/.ssh/known_hosts}} shows GitHub, Bitbucket and my custom host.

The same YML file (changing the docker image back to "php" or the default one) works fine... what am I missing? I'm doing these tests to understand the platform and start building custom images with my own tools already built-in.

Here is the pipeline file:

{code}
#!yml
image: debian:stable-slim

pipelines:
  default:
    - step:
        script:
          - apt-get update && apt-get install -y openssh-client
          - scp -r $USER@$HOST:$PATH .
          - ls -hga test
{code}

Thank you for your time.
fields.summary: "The ECDSA host key has changed" error with some docker images

fields.description: The 'Create issue' button is always aligned to the right side of the browser window, regardless of how wide the window is.  It would be more helpful to have it lined up with the issue form as much as possible.
fields.summary: Create issue and cancel buttons far away from issue form for wider windows
